intro: Podostemum barberi, commonly known as the African water primrose, is a rare aquatic plant native to the fast-flowing rivers of western Africa. It is characterized by its small, floating leaves that are often only a few millimeters in size. The plant thrives in shallow, turbulent waters where it attaches itself to rocks or submerged vegetation. Its flowers are typically white or pink, and they bloom during the wet season. Podostemum barberi plays an important ecological role in its habitat by providing shelter for aquatic invertebrates and small fish.
